content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The figure above shows the graph of the continuous function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The regions <math alttext="A"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="D"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="E"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have areas 5, 2, 16, 5, and 6, respectively. For <math alttext="negative 7 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, negative 6 plus, the integral from, negative 3 to x, of, f of t, d t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Is there a value of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="g of x, equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The figure above shows the graph of the continuous function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The regions <math alttext="A"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="B"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="C"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="D"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="E"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have areas 5, 2, 16, 5, and 6, respectively. For <math alttext="negative 7 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, negative 6 plus, the integral from, negative 3 to x, of, f of t, d t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Is there a value of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="negative 3 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 2"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, such that <math alttext="g of x, equals 0"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(b) Find the absolute minimum value of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and the absolute maximum value of <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="negative 7 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

(c) (i) Find <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, open parenthesis, 2 x plus 16, close parenthesis, d x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.(ii) Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, negative 7 to negative 5, of, f of, open parenthesis, 2 x plus 16, close parenthesis, d x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
